abstract.p: Jewish National Fund vice pres Russell F Robinson letter responds to July 3 news article on alleged uprooting of trees planted in Israel; reports fund's Plant a Tree With Your Own Hands program plants 80,000 trees each year, in addition to more than 2.5 million trees planted yearly by fund's professional foresters (M)

block.p: Re ''Arboreal Scandal in Israel: Not All of the Trees Planted There Stay Planted'' (news article, July 3):
The Jewish National Fund immediately formed a committee to investigate recent allegations about the uprooting of trees, as every tree planted in Israel is precious.
Re ''Arboreal Scandal in Israel: Not All of the Trees Planted There Stay Planted'' (news article, July 3):
The Jewish National Fund immediately formed a committee to investigate recent allegations about the uprooting of trees, as every tree planted in Israel is precious.

Our ''Plant a Tree With Your Own Hands'' program is a crucial part of our national afforestation program, as it allows an individual to directly connect with the land of Israel. Every year, 80,000 saplings are planted through this program, in addition to the more than 2.5 million trees planted throughout Israel yearly by our professional foresters. More than 210 million trees have been planted. For 100 years, our organization has been addressing environmental, water resource and afforestation issues in Israel.
RUSSELL F. ROBINSON New York, July 5, 2000
The writer is executive vice president of the Jewish National Fund.
